dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, big news out of Meta, formerly Facebook, with their latest quarterly report. And, uh, it's pretty wild, honestly. They're talking about their "sweeping efforts" to suppress content, especially on Instagram, and for the first time, like, including Facebook data.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, big news out of Meta, formerly Facebook, with their latest quarterly report. And, uh, it's pretty wild, honestly. They're talking about their sweeping efforts to suppress content, especially on Instagram, and for the first time, like, including Facebook data.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company revealed its sweeping efforts to police its own network in its latest biannual transparency report, which includes data from Instagram for the first time.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but the devil's in the details, right? Because they claim they automatically hide most content, but the really shocking part, to me anyway, is this huge drop in child pornography removals.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but the devil's in the details, right? Because they claim they automatically hide most content, but the really shocking part, to me anyway, is this huge drop in child pornography removals.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Perhaps the most shocking detail in the report is the dramatic increase in the removal of child pornography.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? I mean, they're saying they removed, like, 11.6 million pieces of content with child nudity and exploitation in Q3. But get this: that's roughly *half* the number from Q1. And Instagram actually *added* 1.2 million photos and videos over Q2 and Q3.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? I mean, they're saying they removed, like, eleven point six million pieces of content with child nudity and exploitation in Q three. But get this: that's roughly half the number from Q one. And Instagram actually added one point two million photos and videos over Q two and Q three.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebook says that it removed about 11.6 million pieces of content it deemed to be child nudity and sexual exploitation of children in the third quarter, roughly double the number of pieces of content removed for the same reason in the first quarter. On Instagram, it removed 1.2 million photos and videos involving child nudity or exploitation over the second and third quarters.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, they're removing less, but there's more being added? That just... it doesn't make sense. And Zuckerberg's quote on this, like, "Just because we're reporting low numbers doesn't mean there's so much harmful content..."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, they're removing less, but there's more being added? That just... it doesn't make sense. And Zuckerberg's quote on this, like, Just because we're reporting low numbers doesn't mean there's so much harmful content...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Just because were reporting big numbers doesnt mean theres so much more harmful content happening on our services than others.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which is wild, because he then *also* says, "We are a company of artists who do the bare minimum to identify this behavior." Like, how do you say that out loud?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is wild, because he then also says, We are a company of artists who do the bare minimum to identify this behavior. Like, how do you say that out loud?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We work harder than any other company to identify this behavior, Zuckerberg said in response.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know! And remember when he was getting, like, congressional praise, you know, for his "successful efforts"? Ann Wagner was, uh, applauding him!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! And remember when he was getting, like, congressional praise, you know, for his successful efforts? Ann Wagner was, uh, applauding him!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Representative Ann Wagner (R-MO) scolded Zuckerberg at the hearing, saying, You are not working hard enough, and end-to-end encryption is not going to help the problem.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, saying, "You are working hard enough, and end-to-end encryption is going to help." But then, the FBI director, Christopher Wray, he says that *same* encryption would be a "dream come true for child pornographers."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, saying, You are working hard enough, and end-to-end encryption is going to help. But then, the F B I director, Christopher Wray, he says that same encryption would be a dream come true for child pornographers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Representative Ann Wagner (R-MO) scolded Zuckerberg at the hearing, saying, You are not working hard enough, and end-to-end encryption is not going to help the problem.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! It's such a contradiction. And Zuckerberg himself, later on, opposed his *own* decision to encrypt all user messages because he admitted it would make it harder to police content.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! It's such a contradiction. And Zuckerberg himself, later on, opposed his own decision to encrypt all user messages because he admitted it would make it harder to police content.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Zuckerberg also defended his decision to encrypt all user messages across Facebook services when he was asked about how it would affect the companys ability to police content.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: He said it! He said, "encryption makes it harder for us to see some of the content... the encryption we're proposing would definitely make it harder for us to prevent any of the content [that violates our terms of service]."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He said it! He said, encryption makes it harder for us to see some of the content... the encryption we're proposing would definitely make it harder for us to prevent any of the content that violates our terms of service.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But the encryption were proposing wouldnt make it any harder for us to prevent any of the content [that violates our terms of service].

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, he knows it's a problem, acknowledges it makes it harder for them to stop this horrific stuff, but they're still pushing for it? It's just... I don't get it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, he knows it's a problem, acknowledges it makes it harder for them to stop this horrific stuff, but they're still pushing for it? It's just... I don't get it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But the encryption were proposing wouldnt make it any harder for us to prevent any of the content [that violates our terms of service].

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's a confusing message, at best. I mean, they even mentioned Facebook Messenger was only responsible for, like, 6 of 18.4 million worldwide reports of child sexual abuse material.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a confusing message, at best. I mean, they even mentioned Facebook Messenger was only responsible for, like, six of eighteen point four million worldwide reports of child sexual abuse material.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The New York Times in September claimed that Facebook Messenger was responsible for nearly 12 million of the 18.4 million worldwide reports of child sexual abuse material.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which feels like a distraction from the bigger picture. It just seems like they're trying to spin these numbers, but when you look at the raw data, it's pretty alarming.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which feels like a distraction from the bigger picture. It just seems like they're trying to spin these numbers, but when you look at the raw data, it's pretty alarming.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And that dramatic decrease in removals, while harmful content, you know, seems to be on the rise or at least persistent, it's a huge concern.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And that dramatic decrease in removals, while harmful content, you know, seems to be on the rise or at least persistent, it's a huge concern.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Perhaps the most shocking detail in the report is the dramatic increase in the removal of child pornography.
